contents.label: title
contents.text: A BILL TO BE ENTITLEDAN ACT

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: SECTION 1. Subchapter G， Chapter 5， Water Code， is amended to read as follows：

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: Sec 5.272. CREATION AND GENERAL RESPONSIBILITY OF OFFICE OF NATURAL RESOURCE PUBLIC INTEREST COUNSEL. The Office of Natural Resource Public Interest Counsel is created to ensure that the public interest in environmental quality and consumer protection is represented in all matters before the commission.

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: Sec.5.273. NATURAL RESOURCE PUBLIC INTEREST COUNSEL.(a) The governor with the advice and consent of the senate shall appoint a natural resource public interest counsel to serve as the executive director of the office.

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: Sec.5.274.POWERS AND DUTIES OF COUNSEL AND COMMISSION. (a) The counsel may represent the public interest in any environmental quality or consumer protection issue that arises in a proceeding before the commission. The counsel is entitled to be admitted as a party to any proceeding before the commission.

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: Sec.5.275.REPRESENTATION BY FORMER COUNSEL： PENALTY. (a) A former

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: Sec.5.276.JUDICIAL REVIEW AND APPEAL. The counsel may appeal on behalf of the public an action taken by the commission in a proceeding in which the counsel participated. The counsel may intervene as a matter of right or appear in any other appropriate capacity in a judicial proceeding that arises out of a commission proceeding in which the counsel participated.

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: [See.5.271.CREATION AND GENERAL RESPONSIBILITY OF THE OFFICE OF

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: [See.5.272.PUBLIC INTEREST COUNSEL. The office shall be headed by a public interest counsel appointed by the commission. The executive director may submit the names and qualifieations of eandidates for publie interest counsel to the commission.

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: [See.5.273. DUTIES OF THE PUBLIC INTEREST COUNSEL. The counsel shall represent the public interest and be a party to all preceedings before the commission.

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: [See. 5.274. STAFF. The office shall be adequately staffed to earry-out its funetions under this eode.

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: [Sec.5.275.APPEAL. A ruling， decision， or other act of the commission may not be appealed by the counsel.]

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: SECTION 2. (a) On January 1， 1998， all personnel， office space， facilities， equipment， information， records， case files， and other possessions of the office of public interest counsel of the Texas Natural Resource Conservation Commission are transferred to the Office of Natural Resource Public Interest Counsel created by this Act.

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: SECTION 3. (a) The public interest counsel of the Texas Natural Resource Conservation Commission's office of public interest counsel shall serve as the natural resource public interest counsel of the Office of Natural Resource Public Interest Counsel from January 1， 1998， to February 1， 1999， and until the natural resource public interest counsel for the office is appointed and has qualified.

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: SECTION 4. This Act takes effect January 1， 1998.

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: SECTION 5. The importance of this legislation and the crowded condition of the calendars in both houses create an emergency and an imperative public necessity that the constitutional rule requiring bills to be read on three several days in each house be suspended， and this rule is hereby suspended.
